{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39663].
  {panel}

I am NOT talking about JIRA Service Desk. Which provides these features for Internal Users and seems almost deceptively geared towards them by using terms like "Customer Support Desk", "Customer Portal", and "Customer Knowledge Base", gives many people the impression of a External Support System such as Zendesk, Freshdesk, etc.

However, it seems we would have many hurdles to jump around to utilized it in and close form of this fashion.

We currently have a support team of about 75 agents, which handle 15-30k tickets a month.

They have very specific needs. Customer Login & Ticket History, Chat, Knowledgebase, Screensharing / Video cast / recording, Phone support, etc.

While a few of these can be solved via add-ons and expensive API development. The fundamental backend doesn't support this. Nor does licensing.

Our company is ready to switch off Zendesk. and I'm pushing for JIRA so our 200 employees could collaborate with support, dev, and all around product releases and customer reported bugs etc. But there are many deal breakers here.

Maybe I'm looking at it the wrong way, But as I understand it, We'd need a couple million user license to support this.

And yes I'm aware of mail handlers, etc.

Theres got to be another way?
fields.summary: JIRA as a Product Support Desk

fields.description:
In JIRA 6.3, errors that occur in Soy templates provided by add-ons are no longer logged in the system log. This used to be the case in JIRA 6.2 and prior.

Instead, problems with the template (like a missing Soydoc parameter) are buried in a HTTP 500 response to the request for the template itself.

In most cases, this means that the add-on will still load, but there are no indications that anything has gone wrong in the logs, so it's only when the code tries to call the (now-missing) Soy templates that things explode.

And even then, the only way to find out exactly what is wrong with the Soy file is to grab a Javascript debugger and dig into the 500 response, and find the error in the middle of the HTML response (see screenshot).
fields.summary: Errors in add-on's Soy templates are no longer logged in system log

I would like to retrieve some issues together with their comments and worklogs. Using the *fields=\*all* either in the */issue* or */search* API I can get all the fields including comments and worklogs. The problem is, in such a call, I can get all comments, which are exactly the comments I can get using */issue/<issueId>/comment*, but only 20 worklogs! I need to use a separate call of */issue/<issueId>/worklog* to get all the worklogs.

Is this a bug or with some kind of intension?

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39654].
  {panel}

From JIRA 7.0 we plan to stop providing XML exports of the complete JIRA documentation.

The documentation has grown very large and contains content drawn from a number of other spaces for features that are shared between products (for example user management, application links, the universal plugin manager and more). This has made for a poor experience for users accessing the documentation locally (from an export that has been imported into their Confluence instance). In addition, it provides a less-than-complete experience for our many customers that also use JIRA Agile, JIRA Service Desk, etc.

We will continue to provide PDF exports of the documentation for all major versions of JIRA.

If you have concerns or comments on this decision, please feel free to comment on this ticket.
fields.summary: Feedback on plans to stop providing XML exports of the JIRA documentation

h2. Summary
Jira is returning server error (500) as a part of the response to Parse Exception thrown when typing some characters string in JQL. For example, when there is parseException while invoking /rest/api/2/jql/autocompletedata/suggestions API, Jira is returning "Returning internal server error in responsejava.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException"

h2. How to Replicate
# If you do a JQL search for:
# filter = "some filter name"/asdasd

OR

# Setup a Jira env, I used 8.5.4;
# Create 1 filter called "FilterOne"
# Open jira-application.logs (tail -f)
# Open a JQL advanced search and write: filter = FilterOne
# Then, insert in the final a double-quotes, and then it appears:


We are apparently still doing a lookup for each character added to the end of the string after the endquote, causing a ParseException to be thrown in the logs:

Encountered: <EOF> after : "" at org.apache.lucene.queryparser.classic.QueryParserBase.parse(QueryParserBase.java:114) at com.atlassian.jira.sharing.index.QueryBuilder.parseQuery(QueryBuilder.java:176) ... 287 moreCaused by: org.apache.lucene.queryparser.classic.TokenMgrError: Lexical error at line 1, column 11.  Encountered: <EOF> after : "" at org.apache.lucene.queryparser.classic.QueryParserTokenManager.getNextToken(QueryParserTokenManager.java:1119) at org.apache.lucene.queryparser.classic.QueryParser.jj_3R_3(QueryParser.java:668) at org.apache.lucene.queryparser.classic.QueryParser.jj_3_1(QueryParser.java:702) at org.apache.lucene.queryparser.classic.QueryParser.jj_2_1(QueryParser.java:646) at org.apache.lucene.queryparser.classic.QueryParser.Query(QueryParser.java:225) at org.apache.lucene.queryparser.classic.QueryParser.TopLevelQuery(QueryParser.java:215) at org.apache.lucene.queryparser.classic.QueryParserBase.parse(QueryParserBase.java:109) ... 288 more 
{code}

h2. Investigation Done
After some research, it seems Lucene has problems parsing terms that end with special characters like double-quotes, blankets, and backslash. So, Jira might need to treats it at the code level.

h2. Workaround for Monitoring Tools

You have to adapt your monitoring tools to rule this out on the monitoring tool level itself for the time being, until we can have a code fix. 
For example, rule out any internal server error associated with ParseException.

h2. Suggestion
Our suggestion is that nowhere in the REST API should return 500 responses unless Jira is down. Various 4xx would be much better for a parseException.
fields.summary: Jira is returning server error (500 status code) as a part of the response to Parse Exception

fields.description:
We recently discovered that anyone with the 'Watcher' role (either from being added as a Watcher or being a Component Watcher) will receive email notification regardless of their 'Do not notify' setting (i.e. from user profile preferences). 

The 'Do not notify' setting did prevent emails when a user was only the Assignee (and not a Watcher or Component Watcher) – so it does work in some situations.

Our notification scheme sends emails for the Issue Update event for reporter, watcher, assignee, and some project roles.  I would assume that 'Do not notify' should override ANY of these reasons for notification if the issue change is triggered by the user that would be notified.

I see a couple other similar issues but nothing that specifically mentions the failure due to Watcher status. JRA-28523, JRA-39021.

Thanks
fields.summary: 'Do not notify' setting is not honored when user is a 'Watcher' (or 'Component Watcher')

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39639].
  {panel}

The out of the box names for the CLONE link type are "clones" / "is cloned by", which implies an ongoing relationship between the source issue and the clone.  It causes a lot of confusion with our new (and old) employees who make not unreasonable assumptions, such as workflow transitions on an issue are applied to any issues that clone it.

The normal use case for the clone functionality is to speed up the creation of an issue that is substantially similar to another issue and then only have to edit the fields that differ, and the relationship between the issues is about something that happened historically.  It's still useful to maintain the information for hunting down issues that were unreasonably duplicated.

I suggest that using past tense ("cloned" / "was cloned by") would be more appropriately descriptive.  I even find "clone" to be a misleading term for what it describes, and something like "templated" / "was templated from" might be even better.

It's not clear to me if administrators can even do this themselves.  (See JRA-13976 and JRA-11600)  In any event CLONES is clearly more difficult to change than the other link types and changing it yourself is not recommended.
fields.summary: Rename out-of-box link type "is cloned by" to past tense

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39630].
  {panel}

It would be better if, when you take a bulk change action from an Agile Board, that completion of the bulk change action returns you to the Agile Board view.

Currently on completion of the bulk change you are returned to the issue navigator with the selected issues.

My particular use-case is:

- Go to 'Work mode' view of a Scrum board.

fields.description:
h4. Steps to Reproduce 

# Create a new Classic Project
# Create a new custom field(eg. Checkbox) and associate to Resolve Screen only.
# Add 2 options and set one of it as default value
# Create a new issue in the project

h4. Expected Behaviour

The value is not added for the issue as it is not select or update during issue creation. 

h4.  Actual Behaviour

The default value was entered into the {{customfieldvalue}} table when the issue created. But we know that the field was only available in Resolve Screen and value should be only added to database during issue transition instead of issue creation.

h4. What would be the impact of this issue

It generate wrong result for the users if they used the custom field as search criteria in their filter.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39603].
  {panel}

A customer reported a problem where the wrong value was copied from a Select List (Cascating) in a parent issue to its subtask on creation. This happens when using the post function ‘Copy Value From Other Field’, available with the add-on ‘JIRA Suite Utilities’.

After investigation, I notice that the problem only occurred if different parent options had the same child option values in the Select List custom field. For example:
* Value 1
** Value A
* Value 2
** Value A
** Value B

If the parent issue holds the values (Value 2, Value A), since ‘Value A’ is also present in ‘Value 1’, the value copied is actually (Value 1, Value A), which is not the expected behaviour. It seems that it only takes account of the child options to choose the value. 

If we choose the second parent option created in the list, it actually chooses the first one, though it is unclear if its chosen by order.

*Steps to reproduce*
* Install and enable ‘JIRA Suite Utilities’ add-on
* Create a ‘Select List (Cascating)’ custom field
* Add 2 options (e.g. Value 1 and Value 2) and, within each one, one child option with the same name in both (e.g Value A)
** Pretty much like the example above (no need for Value B)
* Create a project with Subtasks
* Create a specific workflow for the subtasks
* Add a ‘Copy Value From Other Field’ post function to the ‘Create Issue’ transition in this workflow
** Select the created custom field for both source and destination
** Select the option ‘Copy from parent’ option
* Create an issue in the project with the second parent option and equivalent sub-option (e.g. Value 2, Value A)
* Create a Subtask for this task
* Its value for the field will be the first one (Value 1, Valeu A), when it should be the second (i.e. a simple copy).

*Workarounds*
No workaround available.
fields.summary: Copying value from Parent to Subtask on Create Issue Post Function Copies Wrong Value For Select List (Cascating) Custom Field
REST API should allow assignee to be specified by email address
As an admin, I want to be able to set up a default value for "Component field" per issue type

When accessing the [Defining a Project|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Defining+a+Project] page, I would like to have a page describing all default project types.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39598].
  {panel}

Currently, while in the log work screen or the resolve issue screen or the close issue screen, the 'Remaining Estimate' field provides four options via radio buttons. 

These are:
Adjust automatically
Leave estimate unset
Set to.....
Reduce by....

We should be able to customized these based on what may be applicable for our project and make available them available and either suppress display of the other options or at the least grey others out.

Thanks!

Ravi Kanduri

It would be very nice if the name as it appeared in administrative tasks could be different from the way it was presented on screen during editing and viewing.

For instance, I'm trying to create some custom fields to help gather information for user stories, following the format:

As a <role>
I want to <task>
So that <benefit>

The name of these fields should probably be Role, Task, & Benefit.  However, I'd like the screen to read in a little more natural english, like this:

!http://i.imgur.com/Zu2qG32.png!

[This related question on answers|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/285370/jira-custom-field-name-vs-display] currently has 135 followers, indicating some amount of interest in such a feature

fields.description:
When linking JIRA and Bamboo (2-Legged OAuth), if Bamboo's Display URL is different from its own Application URL, then it's not possible to view Bamboo Builds in JIRA's Development Panel. The following message can be seen from the log:
{code}
2014-08-15 23:18:34,906 http-bio-2788-exec-22 WARN admin 1398x67x1 f6o9gj 192.168.8.100,0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/dev-status/1.0/issue/detail [plugin.devstatus.provider.DefaultCoordinator] Requests failed: Andy's Bamboo 5.5.1 (java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Request url 'http://andynguyen.vn/bamboo/rest/jira-dev/latest/detail/build?globalId=TEST-1' doesn't match rpc url 'http://localhost:6551/bamboo')
{code}

This is closely related to JRA-37781, however, JIRA 6.3.3 doesn't fix this problem with Bamboo.

The following screenshots are typical of this problem:
# from Project Administration -> Development tools:
!warning.png|thumbnail!
# from View Issue screen, sometimes no Build is visible in the Development Panel but the Builds tab is visible:
!error1.png|thumbnail!
# sometimes Build is visible in the Development Panel but clicking on it will show this message:
!error2.png|thumbnail!
# from Add-ons -> Application Links, it's clear that Bamboo's Display URL and Application URL are different
!applinks.png|thumbnail!

If Bamboo's Display URL and Application URL are the same, then everything works fine. This is usually a problem for those users who would like to bypass proxy in creating AppLinks i.e. using localhost for Application URL but FQDN for Display URL (and Base URL).
fields.summary: Cannot View Bamboo Builds in Development Panel if Display URL is Different from Application URL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39557].
  {panel}

Dear Atlassian,

Me and my company (www.bedag.ch) have been using the Atlassian products for quite some time and we have noticed the effort you have put in the quality and the user-friendliness of your products in the recent years. Nowadays it's mostly a joy to use Jira and most of the other tools.

However there are still some parts where the work is painful especially on the administration side. We are in the process of setting up Jira projects for a big swiss customer, and they seem to be very happy it. They want more and more of their business processes and departments (that have nothing to do with SW development!) to be supported by Jira. We already have setup many projects with many custom fields and field configurations for them, we currently have about 100 custom fields (~10 pages). Since almost each project is different, we need to setup a different field configuration for each, and in this process we must a hide a lot of the fields. When clicking hide/show for a field, the whole page gets reloaded, and the page jumps to the top. One must scroll down again several times and then exactly find, where the actually changed field was and then continue from there. A setup process that could be as simple as a few minutes (when streamlined) can take now half an hour or so, with much concentration needed as well.

So here is my suggestion: *Could you please change the Show/Hide function on the Field Configuration Admin Page to work via AJAX, so that the whole page doesn't get refreshed and doesn't jump back to the top?* (Pretty many of the other Admin screens could also benefit from AJAXification, but this page would be the most important, I think.)

Actually the whole Field and Screen configuration is in my opinion more complex than it really should be, and nowadays I think this is the least "user"-friendly part of Jira.

I really hope that even in the short term we can experience some "admin"-friendly updates to Jira, so that setting up a project gets almost as easy as using it thereafter.

Thanks and best regards:
Szabolcs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39543].
  {panel}

During the process of deleting JIRA accounts, administrators should have the ability to bulk edit commenters. 

I have read several Atlassian responses to similar JIRA issues that tell users to deactivate accounts instead of deleting. This is not acceptable for our company. We understand and appreciate the value in preserving comment history. However, we would like the ability to shift comments to different users altogether. We have issues with duplicate user accounts under different name formats:
Example: Account Holder= John Doe
Username 1: jdoe
Username 2: johnd

Since the user is actually the same person, we want the option of bulk editing all comments under one username and then changing the commenter to the other. 

Deactivating one account to preserve user history is simply not an acceptable option in this case. The day could come where we need to use one of the duplicate user names for a completely different person.
fields.summary: Bulk edit Commenter

As shown in the [JIRA FishEye/Stash Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jirafisheyeplugin/versions] the plugin is supported for JIRA 6.2 hence the plugin is installed correctly.

*Actual Result:*

*Notes:*
While this issue is not affecting JIRA 6.3.3 and the update button is not showing in JIRA 6.2.1 and above, the information from the page of [JIRA FishEye/Stash Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jirafisheyeplugin/versions] should be updated as it can be found by "Googling" it and by updating the page should able to prevent user encountering this issue.

*Workaround:*
By reverting back the plugin version to the version of the bundled plugin could make the plugin to the working state again. The steps are:
# Stop JIRA
# navigate to _JIRA Home Folder > plugins > installed-plugins_
# find the JIRA Fisheye Plugin (jira-fisheye-plugin-6.X.jar)
# remove the plugin from the folder. (this will make JIRA to revert back to the bundled plugin version on the next start)
# Start JIRA.
